Description: Upper body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic red-figured pottery bell krater; interior black with narrow reserved band near top; exterior: at top, part of reserved band; below, red-figure decoration, judgement of Paris: from left, part of shield, spear, and hand of Athena; head in three-quarter view, with headdress decorated with added white dots, shoulders, and part of arm holding spear, of youth in oriental dress, probably Paris); laurel branch as filling ornament; part of repair hole on left side of sherd.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1169)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (48, pl. 27, 13)
